definitions.text: something that should remain hidden from others (especially information that is not to be passed on)
examples: the combination to the safe was a secret
he tried to keep his drinking a secret

definitions.text: information known only to a special group
something that baffles understanding and cannot be explained
examples: how it got out is a mystery
it remains one of nature's secrets

definitions.text: not open or public; kept private or not revealed
conducted with or marked by hidden aims or methods

examples: their secret signal was a wink
a hidden room or place of concealment such as a priest hole
the secret compartment in the desk

definitions.text: hidden from general view or use
examples: a privy place to rest and think

definitions.text: (of information) given in confidence or in secret
examples: this arrangement must be kept confidential

definitions.text: having an import not apparent to the senses nor obvious to the intelligence; beyond ordinary understanding
examples: the secret learning of the ancients

definitions.text: the next to highest level of official classification for documents
